metadata.title: CVE-2012-2392 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible
metadata.description:
Wireshark 1.4.x before 1.4.13 and 1.6.x before 1.6.8 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) via vectors relatedto the (1) ANSI MAP, (2) ASF, (3) IEEE 802.11, (4) IEEE 802.3, and (5) LTPdissectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-2392` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.6.8-1
libwireshark11 - 1.6.8-1
libwiretap8 - 1.6.8-1
libwscodecs2 - 1.6.8-1
libwsutil9 - 1.6.8-1
tshark - 1.6.8-1
wireshark - 1.6.8-1
wireshark-common - 1.6.8-1
wireshark-gtk - 1.6.8-1
wireshark-qt - 1.6.8-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.8-1').
